post_text: MPV Administration: We understand everyone is a bit anxious about getting information concerning the start of school. The difficulty of releasing plans to this point has been the ever changing directives and guidelines from the department of education and Arkansas Department of Health. Even yesterday, we were informed that we would have to change the date for starting school. When we do send information, we want to be as accurate as humanly possible. Toward that end, the District plans to release a letter to parents and community during the week of July 20th. That date will be one month before school starts on August 24th. We are hopeful the Arkansas Department of Health and Department of Elementary and Secondary Education for Arkansas will be fairly certain of their expectations for us by then. It is important to understand that information could change after that date depending on the status of COVID-19. We appreciate your patience and can’t wait to see our students!

INSTRUCTOR SPOTLIGHT: Dr. Lonnie Myers

"It can be tough for the adult student to balance school, work, and life. I have been there as an adult learner. When I worked on my doctorate with Harding University, there were times when I felt unprepared, less knowledgeable than others and definitely intimidated by the expectations of balancing school, work and life. The Harding Professors were there for me and met me exactly where I was as an individual learner. From the first day, I received the support and encouragement I needed to succeed. I desire to emulate those role models in the early days of the Harding Educational Leadership Doctoral Program. I want to be there when my graduate students need me just as my professors were there for me."

Gary Baxter
January 20 at 8:22 PM ·

Our contractor and Mulberry Public Works employees worked today to isolate areas to replace and repair some old Fire Hydrants and leaking water valves. A few areas of Mulberry near Main Street may have temporary interruptions to water service as the repairs are being made over the next few days. We do not anticipate large areas of the City to be out of service at any time. Mulberry Water Department employees will attempt to notify residents of affected areas prior to any interruption. The contractor will be trying to work with water pressures being maintained high enough that boil orders will not be required. Our crews are working diligently to ensure any interruption will be of a short duration. Thank you for your understanding and please share with Mulberry residents.
